description.narrative: At least 25% of the educational communities of prioritized schools from the basic education subsystem develop practices in school management to facilitate the attendance, permanence and inclusion of children and adolescents in the school, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2019, UNICEF will have contributed to ensuring that children and adolescents (particularly the most excluded) are attending and remaining within educational facilities and that these latter are improving their quality of teaching and educational content, using a rights, gender, adolescent development, intercultural and bilingual approach.

participating-org.narrative: COMITATO INTERNAZIONALE PER LO SVIL DEI POPOLI

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: At least 25% of the educational communities of prioritized schools from the basic education subsystem develop practices in schoolmanagement to facilitate the attendance, permanence and inclusion of children and adolescents in the school

description.narrative: In 2020, Communication for Development in Education used multiple strategies and approaches to support Education during COVID-19 pandemic context. C4D supported Education Section with the objective of accompanying teachers, parents and children to adapt themselves to the new education system at home. Different materials were created to be shared, broadcasted and distributed in several channels in order to provide key messages to facilitate behavior change in the maintenance the education process at home and enrollment of children and adolescents in the school to keep the distance education. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:19/01/2021
